thread.title: Carlton: The difference between Texas quarterbacks Jerrod Heard and Tyrone Swoopes
thread.title_full: Carlton: The difference between Texas quarterbacks Jerrod Heard and Tyrone Swoopes | Dallas Morning News

author: Chuck Carlton
title: Carlton: The difference between Texas quarterbacks Jerrod Heard and Tyrone Swoopes
text:
Big 12 analyst Chuck Carlton held a chat on Thursday, here are a couple of takeaways about the Texas Longhorns.
What does Jerrod Heard bring to UT attack that Swoopes doesn't?
Carlton: "So far, it seems like Heard plays his best when the lights come in a game atmosphere. With Swoopes, it was almost the opposite, that he was better in practice than games. And Heard is mobile, which is a huge asset when things break down with the young offensive line. Swoopes could occasionally scramble for five yards. Heard can go for 50."
Do you get the sense that Swoopes was just an OC endorsed option or do you think Strong was truly on board?
Carlton: "Clearly, former play-caller Shawn Watson seemed fond of Tyrone Swoopes. And Swoopes' skill-set was a better fit for the pro style that Watson favored. He also was probably a better practice QB. We'll get a better sense of Heard's readiness for prime time against a Cal team on Saturday that is a lot better than most people may think."
If you want to read more, go to the full chat here .
